profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for the delivering and implementation of the Risk Inventory and Evaluation for the Netherlands business. Successfully developed and implemented comprehensive health, safety, and well-being policies and systems within the Startup business and newly created function.

• Managing a team of 2 auditors delivering audits to evaluate compliance with health, safety, and well-being standards and recommend corrective actions. Also managing 2 trainers delivering accredited rider safety training to more than 600 riders across the store network.

• Completed risk assessments, hazard identifications, and incident investigations to proactively mitigate occupational health and safety risks.

• Liaise with external agencies and regulatory bodies to ensure adherence to legal requirements and maintain positive working relationships.
profile_positions.title: Health And Safety Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for the health and safety of 850 employees globally. Newly created function
within this start-up organisation that involves the creation of policy and procedures along
with a new safety culture to take the business to the next level.

• Ensuring all VanMoof locations meet health and safety requirements (emergency
procedures, dangerous goods compliance with lithium battery storage and transportation
and incident and accident reporting.

• Designed and implemented a company specific incident report form. Since its inception
accident and incident trends have been presented to the Leadership Team and developed
targeted prevention campaigns to reduce and/or eliminate similar incidents in the future.

• Engaging all levels of the organisation to encourage wider engagement on health and
safety. Created a Health and safety focus group with the regional management team.
Utilised this group to have regular and focused interaction with the retail and warehousing
teams.

• Partnered with Specialists in the field of dangerous goods, specifically lithium batteries to
deliver awareness and specialist training associated with the transportation and storage of
dangerous goods.

home improvements business. Services offered include: made to measure cupboards and
cabinets; painting; and flooring.

• Gained extensive entrepreneurial skills in this area, including client management, pricing,
budgeting and supply chain management.
profile_positions.title: Business Owner

profile_positions.description:
• Maintain and develop internal management systems to meet requirements in ISO 9001,
OHSAS 18001, ISO 45001 and ISO 14001. Developed bespoke management system for
the new Central Production Facility and was Certified by the Local Government (NVWA)
Approval Scheme.

• Responsible for the laboratory analysis of prepared sushi, individual ingredients, and
surfaces. Conducted trend analysis of laboratory tests and dedicated liaison with the
laboratories following out of scope sample results.

• Auditing Kiosks as well as suppliers in accordance with company standards to meet
minimum legal requirement and fulfil the ISO requirements and maintain accreditations.
profile_positions.title: Quality Manager

profile_positions.description:
Self employed consultant delivering services to clients to review global standards regarding Food Safety, Health and Safety, Environment and Crisis Management.  Develop management systems to meet requirements in ISO 9001, OHSAS 18001, ISO 45001 and ISO 14001.

•  Deliver training on appreciative investigation to assist organization to analyze 'work as it is done’ and not’ work as it is imagined’.  This develops a business culture of more transparency and openness to share how work can be improved.

•  Develop and review audits to deliver greater trend analysis and to focus on targeted initiatives to improve compliance
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the development and delivery of the HSE strategy across the B&I Support Services business sectors which includes VSG, ICM and 14Forty.  These business sectors deliver specialist services in security solutions, cleaning and facilities management. 

•  Coordinate and Manage the activities of three HSE Managers and one HSE administrator which forms part of the B&I Support Services team.

•  Maintain the ISO standards of ISO 9001, OHSAS 18001 and ISO 14001 for B&I Support Services and manage the auditing process internally to measure the performance against all three ISO standards.

•  Single point of contact for the legal team and the external insurers when reviewing claims data and claim mitigation initiatives directly associated with B&I Support Services.

•  Chair the risk committee meeting consisting of operators and other support functions.  The risk committee review claim and accident data to identify trends and develop targeted safety campaigns.

•  Networking with counterparts in other service streams within Compass sharing best practice and providing specialist advice and solutions. 

•  Participate in the British Security Industry Association (BSIA) Safety forum where we review HSE related trends and work collaboratively with competitors and the national security licensing organisation (SIA) on key safety initiatives across the security industry.

•  Active participant within the HSE Technical Support Group responsible for developing policies and procedures related to non-food activities that are adopted by Compass Group UK and Ireland.
profile_positions.title: Head of HSE

profile_positions.description:
Communicate at a strategic level to the Operations Directors and Managing Director weekly on progress regarding specific HSE initiatives as well as reactive business need for example following an incident.

•  Maintain the ISO standards of ISO 9001, ISO 18001 and ISO 14001 for 350 catering outlets nationally.  Managed the auditing process internally to measure the performance against all three ISO standards.

•  Responsible for reactive work such as accident investigations and food complaints.  Lessons learned documents are produced that are shared with the wider business, as well as direct correspondence with the injured party.

•  Completed a safety culture train the trainer course.  Delivered several safety culture gap analysis sessions with a wide variety of operators.  These sessions has led to the development and delivery of bespoke initiatives to address the areas identified for improvement.

•  Provide support to our sales team in relation with HSE related questions on questionnaires for new and existing business, as well as attending several sales presentations with prospective clients as the subject matter expert.
profile_positions.title: Environment, Health and Safety Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for groups of catering facilities advising on food safety and health and safety aspects.  The main activities involved are detailed below:

•  Personalizing a comprehensive Food Safety Management System for each food business that is visited.  Amend existing HACCP documentation should processes and activities change within the food business.

•  Completing site specific Risk Assessments for COSHH, Manuel Handling, General Activites.

•  Auditing restaurants, pubs, coffee shops and night clubs on legal compliance of occupational health and safety, food safety, fire safety and infrastructure requirements.

•  Providing formal and accredited (CIEH) training to management and catering staff on food hygiene, health and safety and fire safety within the workplace.  Also provided food safety and health and safety training for all Starbucks Store Managers and Supervisors at Starbucks head office.

•  Responsible for investigation of alleged food poisoning complaints and foreign body investigation.  Also liaise with external organizations such as suppliers and local authorities.  Provide feedback to customers and communicate recommendation to clients to avoid any reoccurrences.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
The responsibility of the Environmental Health Technician was medical force protection, which included food safety, health and safety, environmental monitoring, water testing and education of the troops on health risks associated with specific areas of deployment.

•  Defence Medical Services Training Centre (2 Years) - Responsibilities within department included teaching on the various courses run by the department, and fulfilling the role as course manager for one of the rotation courses for the junior paramedics.  Lectured students up to Foundation Degree level and assisted in the delivery of the NEBOSH General Certificate to the same student group. 

•  British Army Training Support Unit Belize (6 Month Deployment) - Conducted site-specific risk assessments on six locations capable of holding in excess of 250 troops each in the remote parts of the Belize Jungle.  At the same time completed water testing of the potable water in these locations.

•  Headquarters 4th Division (2 years) - Carried out routine and specialist surveys in heating, lighting, ventilation, noise, dust, building standards and occupational hygiene.  Compiled reports detailing observations and recommendations

•  National Support Element Afghanistan (7 Month Deployment) - Conducted health and safety advisory visits to all departments including contractors operating on military establishments.  Additional aspects included food hygiene, auditing of pest control contractors, water quality analysis and monitoring.

Head Quarters Northern Ireland (12 Months) - Broadened experience by attending EHO student-training workshops presented by Belfast City Council in port health, housing and fitness of food.  Gained additional local authority experience during a 2 week placement with Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council to fulfil requirements set in the portfolio of evidence.
